headline: Hunger Strike Claims Life Of American In Egypt Prison
abstract: Moustafa Kassem, detained in Cairo in 2013 and suffering from serious medical problems, had protested his innocence.
lead_paragraph: CAIRO â€” An American imprisoned in Egypt for six years on what he insisted were false charges, and whose case had been championed by Vice President Mike Pence, died on Monday after a long hunger strike, the State Department said.
keywords: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
